datasetPresenter.displayName: B. bovis strain T2Bo Sequence and Annotation
datasetPresenter.description:
B. bovis strain T2Bo is a tick-transmitted parasite of cattle.

A combined sequencing approach consisting of a clone by clone and whole genome shotgun method (8x coverage) was used to generate the complete genome sequence of B. bovis T2Bo strain. There are four chromosomes in this strain (other B. bovis strains have been found to present only three chromosomes in their haploid genomes). The gap closure phase of this sequencing project has resulted in 13 contigs.

This Whole Genome Shotgun project has been deposited at DDBJ/EMBL/GenBank under the project accession AAXT00000000.

Chromosomes 2 and 3 are complete. Chromosome 4 is in three pieces that could not be assembled definitively, but the chromosome is covered. Chromosome 1 has a large gap full of repetitive sequences, and the small contigs are within the gap. The order and orientation of the pieces of chromosome 1 and chromosome 4 are not known.

Additionally, the complete apicoplast genome sequence is available in GenBank under accession AAXT01000007, and the complete mitochondrial genome sequence under GenBank accession EU075182.

The genome sequencing project is a collaboration between Washington State University, the Agricultural Research Service - Animal Disease Research Unit and The Institute for Genomic Research. The complete and annotated nuclear, apicoplast and mitochondrial genome sequence have been published.

datasetPresenter.displayName: T. annulata strain Ankara Sequence and Annotation
datasetPresenter.description: The T. annulata strain Ankara reference sequence (RefSeq) genome is provided by the NCBI. It is a copy of the T. annulata strain Ankara genome sequence submitted to GenBank/EMBL/DDBJ by the Sanger Institute.
HSSP (homology-derived structures of proteins) is a derived database merging structural (2-D and 3-D) and sequence information (1-D).

datasetPresenter.displayName: T. parva strain Muguga Sequence and Annotation
datasetPresenter.description: The reference sequence (RefSeq) genome assembly for T. parva strain Muguga is provided by NCBI and based on sequence, assembly and annotation submitted by The Institute for Genomic Research (TIGR)

contact.name: Audrey Lau
contact.institution: Washington State University College of Veterinary Medicine

datasetPresenter.displayName: B. bovis Attenuated vs. Virulent strain - array data
datasetPresenter.summary: The mechanisms of virulence loss was investigated at the whole genome level using B. bovis as a model apicomplexan in which genetically related attenuated parasites can be reliably derived from virulent parental strains in the natural host.
datasetPresenter.description: The mechanisms of virulence loss was investigated at the whole genome level using B. bovis as a model apicomplexan in which genetically related attenuated parasites can be reliably derived from virulent parental strains in the natural host.
